title: Leonard Leo Joins Federalist Society, Becomes Judicial Selection Architect
summary: Leonard Leo joins the Federalist Society in its early years when it was just beginning to build a conservative judicial pipeline. Leo would become co-chairman and the organization's most influential figure, earning the title "architect of the Supreme Court's conservative supermajority." His systematic approach to identifying, vetting, and promoting conservative legal talent through dark money networks transforms the Federalist Society from a student organization into the most powerful force in American judicial selection, ultimately placing six affiliated justices on the Supreme Court.
